definition: to rotate (about an axis)/to revolve/to turn/to move in a circle/to gyrate
to turn sth around/to swivel
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
moment of inertia (mechanics)
rigid rotation
rotor
axis of rotation (mechanics)/spindle

sentences.english: Bearings allow the shaft to turn while permitting the housing to remain still.
sentences.chinese: 轴承允许传动轴转动的同时允许壳体保持静止。

sentences.english: A new type of continuous contact model was developed for a spatial revolute joint.
sentences.chinese: 提出了一种新型空间间隙转动副的连续接触模型。

sentences.english: His old legs and shoulders pivoted with the swinging of the pulling.
sentences.chinese: 他一把把地拉着，两条老迈的腿儿和肩膀跟着转动。

sentences.english: The twisting and moving slowed down, halting the lights.
sentences.chinese: 星云旋转和转动的速度降了下来，亮度也变暗了。

sentences.english: When the fruit rotates, the peeling function is realized.
sentences.chinese: 当水果转动起来后，就实现了削皮功能。

sentences.english: The ailerons are moved in opposite senses to make the plane roll.
sentences.chinese: 副翼向相反的方向转动就会使得飞机翻滚。

sentences.english: But it's completely different, the moment of inertia, if you rotated it about this axis.
sentences.chinese: 但它完全不同，转动惯量，如果将其绕这轴旋转。

sentences.english: Each of the nine planets turns on its own axis.They all go around the sun the same way.
sentences.chinese: 九大行星都自转，它们又都围着太阳按同一方向转动。

sentences.english: As soon as the captain heard the sound of the lock being turned, he stepped forward.
sentences.chinese: 一听到锁的转动声，船长就立刻一步跨世上前去。

sentences.english: The radio's dial twirled and the lights behind the tuning panel went out.
sentences.chinese: 收音机的调谐钮转动了一下，面板上的指示灯熄灭了。

sentences.english: The captain put the wheel over and steered northwest.
sentences.chinese: 船长转动舵轮，向西北方向驶去。

sentences.english: Modern clock inspired by the movement of Japanese folding fan.
sentences.chinese: 受日本折扇的转动所启发而制作的时尚时钟。

sentences.english: Almost all moment of inertia is in this system.
sentences.chinese: 几乎所有这个系统中的转动惯量。

sentences.english: So we know the moment of inertia.
His insincerity is revealed by the quick goggle of his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他眼睛的快速转动泄露了他的不诚。

sentences.english: Relativistic mean field theory in the rotating frame is used to describe superdeformed nuclei.
sentences.chinese: 用转动框架中的相对论平均场理论描述超形变核。

definition: to rotate/to revolve/to spin/to whirl
to roll/to turn over/to invert/to flip
to sway/to rock
to sway/to swing/to move back and forth/to oscillate
to spin rapidly/to whirl around/(of time) to fly by
to shake/to sway
to tremble
to stir/to prod/to poke/to move sideways/to strum (on a guitar etc)
to rotate/to twirl/to run around/to encircle/rotation/(coll.) to speak indirectly/to beat about the bush
to tremble
to shake/to fling one's arm/to lash/to swing
to rock/to shake/to sway
(machine) gear/pinion (gear wheel)
to throb/to pulse/to bounce/to jiggle/to jump about
to roll/(to do sth) in a loop/to scroll (computing)/to progressively expand (economics)/to rumble (of thunder)
to work/to operate/to revolve/to turn around
